dataset.title: Biomass %N, %C, natural abundance 15N and 13C isotopic signatures for common and rare under- and overstory plants in long unburned and burned (1999) boreal forest stands, Caribou-Poker Creek and Delta Junction

address.deliveryPoint: Room 221, Department of Biology, University of Florida

abstract.para: This dataset contains leaf, aboveground stem, and fruit carbon and N concentration and natural abundance isotope data for new and old tissue fractions of common and rare plant species in burned and unburned black spruce forest stands. Stands were located in either Caribou-Poker Creek or Delta Junction, in either unburned areas, or in areas burned in 1999 fires. Biomass was collected between 2000 and 2001 in mid-July at peak biomass.

section.title: Access to Data
section.para: While metadata will be freely available to those requesting it, the data manager will assure that any restrictions on access to data sets in the database will be enforced. Data will not be released without proper permission first being obtained from the investigator who generated the data.

section.title: Use of data
section.para: Researchers should receive adequate acknowledgment for the use of their data by others and should be provided with copies of publications using their data. Users of data from the data base must be aware that data is not to be sold or redistributed.

section.title: Citing Bonanza Creek LTER Datasets
section.para: It is considered a matter of professional ethics to acknowledge the work of other scientists. Thus, the Data User will properly cite the Data Set in any publications or in the metadata of any derived data products that were produced using the Data Set.

section.title: Experimental Design
section.para: Four "blocks" of relatively homogeneous forest structure were identified in each sampling site. In CPCRW, 8 blocks were located prior to the "Frostfire" experimental burn in 1999. Half of the blocks were burned. In Delta Junction, sites were located after the 1999 Donnelly Flats fire. Unburned blocks were selected that had similar pre-fire black spruce stand density, mean tree diameter, and organic layer thickness as burned blocks.

section.title: Methods
section.para: FIELD: Biomass samples of each species were, when present, collected from four 100 x 100m areas in each site and treatment that were seperated by at least 500m. Thus, the maximum n=4 for each treatment (unburned or burned) within each site (CPCRW or Delta Junction). The majority of species were sampled in 2000. However, some species not present in 2000 had recruited into plots by 2001, and they were sampled during that year. LAB: Biomass for each species was sorted into leaves (new and old, if evergreen), new and old stems, and fruits, and dried at 60 degrees C until at a constant mass. Samples were ground to a fine and homogendous powder on a Spex Certiprep mixer-mill and C and N concentration and 15N and 13C isotopic signature was analyzed on a Europa Scientific xxxx Conflow mass spectrometer with an in-line Fissons Instruments CHN analyzer.

dataTable.entityDescription: This dataset contains leaf, aboveground stem, and fruit carbon and N concentration and natural abundance isotope data for new and old tissue fractions of common and rare plant species in burned and unburned black spruce forest stands.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Name of site where measurement was made (Helmer's Ridge; Caribou-Poker Creek Research Watershed; 65.15 lat, 147.49 lon; elevation is 350 m asl and Donnelly Flats; Delta Junction; 63.9167 lat, 145.7333 lon ;elevation is 400m asl)

textDomain.definition: Name of site where measurement was made (Helmer's Ridge; Caribou-Poker Creek Research Watershed; 65.15 lat, 147.49 lon; elevation is 350 m asl and Donnelly Flats; Delta Junction; 63.9167 lat, 145.7333 lon ;elevation is 400m asl)

attribute.attributeDefinition: Burn state of Black spruce stands, unburned or burned in 1999; Helmer's Ridge was burned in the 1999 Frostfire experimental burn, while Donnelly Flats was burned in the 1999 Donnelly Flats wildfire.
Plant growth form or lichen (Evergreen tree, Evergreen shrub, Deciduous tree, Deciduous shrub, Forb, Graminoid, Pteridophyte, Bryophyte, Lichen, or Fungi)

textDomain.definition: Plant growth form or lichen (Evergreen tree, Evergreen shrub, Deciduous tree, Deciduous shrub, Forb, Graminoid, Pteridophyte, Bryophyte, Lichen, or Fungi)

attribute.attributeDefinition: Vascular plants and some non-vascular plants are identified by the first three letters of genus and first three letters of species. Some bryophytes, pteridophytes and lichens are identified by genus.

textDomain.definition: Vascular plants and some non-vascular plants are identified by the first three letters of genus and first three letters of species. Some bryophytes, pteridophytes and lichens are identified by genus.

attribute.attributeDefinition: New or old leaves and stems; fruits; dead; forbs, mosses, pteridophytes and lichesn are "all" indicating that biomass was not sorted into tissue types

textDomain.definition: New or old leaves and stems; fruits; dead; forbs, mosses, pteridophytes and lichesn are "all" indicating that biomass was not sorted into tissue types

attribute.attributeDefinition: The percentage of tissue mass that is nitrogen (% N by dry mass)
The percentage of tissue mass that is carbon (% C by dry mass)
The nitrogen isotopic signature of tissue (In delta units, per mil)
The carbon isotopic signature of tissue (In delta units, per mil)
